TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit HtmlTableRowCollection extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable
Public NotInheritable Class HtmlTableRowCollection Implements ICollection
public ref class HtmlTableRowCollection sealed : System::Collections::ICollection
type HtmlTableRowCollection = class interface ICollection interface IEnumerable

Docs.summary: A collection of objects that represent the rows of an control. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection> class to programmatically manage a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> objects that represent the rows in an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable> control. This class is commonly used to add, remove, or modify the contents of a row in an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable> control.
> [!NOTE] > An <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable> control contains a <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable.Rows%2A> property that represents a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> objects. Each <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> represents an individual row in the table. An <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> contains a <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.Cells%2A> property that represents a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableCell> objects. These objects, in turn, represent the individual cells of the table. To retrieve an individual cell, first get the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> object, representing the row containing the cell, from the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable.Rows%2A> collection of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable> control. You can then get the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableCell> object, representing the cell in the row, from the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow.Cells%2A> collection of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to dynamically generate the contents of an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable> control by adding rows to an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection> collection. Notice that the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable.Rows%2A> property of a table is the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection> object.
[!code-aspx-csharp[HtmlTableRowCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HtmlTableRowCollection/CS/htmltablerowcollectioncs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[HtmlTableRowCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HtmlTableRowCollection/VB/htmltablerowcollectionvb.aspx#1)]

Docs.param: The to add to the collection.
Docs.summary: Appends the specified object to the end of the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to add the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> object to the end of an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection> collection. To insert an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> in the middle of the collection, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection.Insert%2A> method.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection.Add%2A> method to append a row of a table, represented by an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> object, to the end of an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection> collection. Notice that the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable.Rows%2A> property of a table is the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection> object.
[!code-aspx-csharp[HtmlTableRowCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HtmlTableRowCollection/CS/htmltablerowcollectioncs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[HtmlTableRowCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HtmlTableRowCollection/VB/htmltablerowcollectionvb.aspx#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Clear() cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes all objects from the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to remove all <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> objects from the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection> collection and reset the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection.Count%2A> property to `0`.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection.Clear%2A> method to remove all items from the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection> collection. New entries are then added to the collection and displayed in the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable> control.
[!code-aspx-csharp[HtmlTableRowCollectionClear#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HtmlTableRowCollectionClear/CS/htmltablerowcollectionclearcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[HtmlTableRowCollectionClear#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HtmlTableRowCollectionClear/VB/htmltablerowcollectionclearvb.aspx#1)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to copy the contents of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection> collection into the specified <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=nameWithType> object, starting at the specified index in the array.
> [!NOTE] > The `array` parameter must be a zero-based <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=nameWithType>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection.CopyTo%2A> method to create an array that contains the same contents as the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection> collection. The array is then iterated through to display the contents of the collection.

public: property int Count { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the number of objects in the collection.
Docs.value: The number of objects in the . The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection.Count%2A> property to determine the number of rows contained in the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection> collection. The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection.Count%2A> property is commonly used when iterating through the collection to determine the upper bound.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection.Count%2A> property to determine the number of rows in the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable> control. This value is then used as the upper bound of a loop to iterate through the rows of a table.
[!code-aspx-csharp[HtmlTableRowCollectionCount#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HtmlTableRowCollectionCount/CS/htmltablerowcollectioncountcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[HtmlTableRowCollectionCount#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HtmlTableRowCollectionCount/VB/htmltablerowcollectioncountvb.aspx#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator() cil managed
abstract member GetEnumerator : unit -> System.Collections.IEnumerator override this.GetEnumerator : unit -> System.Collections.IEnumerator

Docs.summary: Returns an -implemented object that contains all objects in the collection.
Docs.returns: An -implemented object that contains all objects in the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to create an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=nameWithType>-implemented object that can be iterated through to get each item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection> collection.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property to get the current element in the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method to move to the next item in the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method to move the enumerator to the initial position.
> [!NOTE] > You must call the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method after creating an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=nameWithType>-implemented object, or after using the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method to move the enumerator to the first item in the collection. Otherwise, the item represented by the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property is undefined.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection.GetEnumerator%2A> method to create an <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=nameWithType> object. The <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=nameWithType> object is then iterated through to display the contents of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection> collection.
[!code-aspx-csharp[HtmlTableRowCollectionGetEnumerator#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HtmlTableRowCollectionGetEnumerator/CS/htmltablerowcollectionienumeratorcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[HtmlTableRowCollectionGetEnumerator#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HtmlTableRowCollectionGetEnumerator/VB/htmltablerowcollectionienumeratorvb.aspx#1)]

Public Sub Insert (index As Integer, row As HtmlTableRow)

Docs.param: The location in the at which to add the .
Docs.summary: Adds an object to the specified location in the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection.Insert%2A> method to add the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> object to an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection> collection at the specified index. If you simply want to append an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> to the end of the collection, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection.Add%2A> method.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection.Insert%2A> method to insert a row of a table, represented by an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> object, into an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection> collection.
[!code-aspx-csharp[HtmlTableRowCollectionInsert#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HtmlTableRowCollectionInsert/CS/htmltablerowcollectioninsertcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[HtmlTableRowCollectionInsert#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HtmlTableRowCollectionInsert/VB/htmltablerowcollectioninsertvb.aspx#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsReadOnly As Boolean
public: property bool IsReadOnly { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the collection is read-only.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property always returns `false` to indicate that the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection> collection can be written to in all cases.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property IsSynchronized As Boolean
public: property bool IsSynchronized { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether access to the collection is synchronized (thread safe).
Docs.value: in all cases, which indicates that access to the is not synchronized (not thread safe).

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is derived from <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=nameWithType> and is overridden to always return `false` to indicate that access to the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection> collection is not synchronized (not thread safe).
For more information on the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection.IsSynchronized%2A> property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=nameWithType> interface.

MemberSignature.Value: Default Public ReadOnly Property Item(index As Integer) As HtmlTableRow

Docs.param: An ordinal index value that specifies the to return.
Docs.summary: Gets the object at the specified index from the collection.
Docs.value: An that represents a row contained in the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this indexer to get an individual <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> object from the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection> collection at a specified index, using simple array notation.
> [!NOTE] > The collection is zero-based; therefore, the first element in the collection contains an index value of `0`.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the indexer to retrieve a table row, represented by an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> object, from the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection> collection. The cells in the row are then updated with new content. Notice that the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable.Rows%2A> property of the table is the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection> object.
[!code-aspx-csharp[HtmlTableRowCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HtmlTableRowCollection/CS/htmltablerowcollectioncs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[HtmlTableRowCollection#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HtmlTableRowCollection/VB/htmltablerowcollectionvb.aspx#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Remove(class System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow row) cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes the specified object from the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to remove the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> object from the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection> collection.
> [!NOTE] > If you specify an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> that does not exist in the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection>, no item is removed from the collection.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection.Remove%2A> method to remove the specified table row, represented by an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> object, from the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection> collection. This example removes the cells from the first row of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable> control.
[!code-aspx-csharp[HtmlTableRowCollectionRemove#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HtmlTableRowCollectionRemove/CS/htmltablerowcollectionremovecs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[HtmlTableRowCollectionRemove#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HtmlTableRowCollectionRemove/VB/htmltablerowcollectionremovevb.aspx#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void RemoveAt(int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: The index of the to remove from the .
Docs.summary: Removes the object at the specified index from the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to remove the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRow> object at the specified index from the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection> collection. The index number is zero-based. Therefore, the first item in the collection has an index value of `0`.
> [!NOTE] > If you specify an index that is outside the range of index values, an exception is raised.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method to remove the item at the specified index from the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection> collection. This example removes the first row of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTable> control.
[!code-aspx-csharp[HtmlTableRowCollectionRemoveAt#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HtmlTableRowCollectionRemoveAt/CS/htmltablerowcollectionremoveatcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[HtmlTableRowCollectionRemoveAt#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/HtmlTableRowCollectionRemoveAt/VB/htmltablerowcollectionremoveatvb.aspx#1)]

Docs.exception: The specified index is outside the range of index values in the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property SyncRoot As Object
public: property System::Object ^ SyncRoot { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
Docs.value: An object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The object returned in this implementation is the current instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableRowCollection> class.
For more information on the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlTableCellCollection.SyncRoot%2A> property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=nameWithType> interface.
